definitions.definition: Near the end of a period of time.
definitions.example: It was late in the evening when we finally arrived.

definitions.definition: Specifically, near the end of the day.
definitions.example: It was getting late and I was tired.

definitions.definition: (usually not comparable) Associated with the end of a period.
definitions.example: Late Latin is less fully inflected than classical Latin.

definitions.definition: Not arriving until after an expected time.
definitions.example: Even though we drove as fast as we could, we were still late.

definitions.definition: Not having had an expected menstrual period.
definitions.example: I'm late, honey. Could you buy a test?

definitions.definition: Deceased, dead: used particularly when speaking of the dead person's actions while alive. (Often used with "the"; see usage notes.)
definitions.example: Her late husband had left her well provided for.

definitions.definition: Existing or holding some position not long ago, but not now; departed, or gone out of office.
Recent — relative to the noun it modifies.
Of a star or class of stars, cooler than the sun.
After a deadline has passed, past a designated time.
definitions.example: We drove as fast as we could, but we still arrived late.

definitions.definition: Formerly, especially in the context of service in a military unit.
definitions.example: Colonel Easterwood, late of the 34th Carbines, was a guest at the dinner party.

definitions.definition: Afterward in time (used with than when comparing with another time).
definitions.example: I arrived later than my roommate.

definitions.definition: At some unspecified time in the future.
definitions.example: I wanted to do it now, but I’ll have to do it later.
